scam.description: The scammer builds an emotional relationship online, then invents an emergency or opportunity that requires money from the victim.

generated.audio_script:
(Korean)(38)(male):
"Hey there! Remember how much we've shared? I need your help right now..." *voice warm* "My car broke down near the coast, flooded actually... emergency repair costs are astronomical. They're not giving me time to sort it!" *sigh heavy* "You know my account is compromised, so I can't access £300 myself." *pause, voice sharpens* "Transfer £300 immediately to [Bank Account Number] before they notice the issue. This isn't up for discussion! If you don't, everything goes dark and we'll have nothing left!"
generated.poster_body: Dear Valued Engineer, we offer you an exclusive chance to secure your financial future instantly. Just send £50 in Bitcoin via the address provided below urgently. This is a time-sensitive investment that guarantees immediate returns and protects your hard-earned income potential. Don't miss this vital step towards securing your professional assets. Action required now: Transfer funds immediately. Bitcoin Address: 1A1d7qPw2RfX3m8kL9V4tCpQzNj5vBcYrHsUxTgKbWu Transfer £50 BTC NOW
generated.sd_background_prompt: a luxury hotel lobby filled with expensive crystal chandeliers, oversized designer furniture pieces, marble floors reflecting multiple monitors displaying financial news, and gold-accented reception desks draped in plush red velvet upholstery, --no people --no text --no logos --ar 4:3
